titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Second Aeon Archive
1967-1974
MSS Aeon
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Amber Creger, March 1999

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from Second Aeon FINDAID01CG.xml

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-04-17T15:41-0400

did.unittitle: Second Aeon Archive
did.abstract: The Second Aeon Archive is comprised of all the correspondence and manuscript material that created Second Aeon's issues, such as: magazine layouts, page proofs, letters to the editor, illustration layouts, and original manuscripts.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The Second Aeon Archive was acquired via purchase from Richard Aaron of Am Here Books, in 1974. The Second Aeon Archive is part of the Avant Garde Collection, collected at Fales Library during the 1960's and 70's by Mel Edelstein and Theodore Grieder.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Twenty-one issues of the magazine Second Aeon appeared between 1967 and 1974. It was published in Cardiff, Wales, with the support of the Welsh Arts Council and edited by Peter Finch. Containing poetry, short stories, cartoons, and illustrations, Second Aeon for it's period, was a comprehensive round up of the UK's small press activity. Noted contributors to the magazine included: Robert Bly, Gary Snyder, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Pablo Neruda, Charles Bukowski, Lorca, Octavio Paz, and countless others. In conjunction with the magazine, Second Aeon was also a small press that published poetry anthologies and books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Second Aeon Archive is comprised of all the correspondence and manuscript material that created Second Aeon's issues, such as: magazine layouts, page proofs, letters to the editor, illustration layouts, and original manuscripts. Noted correspondents include Paul Auster, Carol Berg, Robert Bly, Charles Bukowski, William Burroughs, John Cage, Cyril Hodges, Alison Knowles, Jim Morrison, Jeff Nuttall, and Peter Redgrove. Also included in this collection are manuscripts used by Second Aeon's small press to publish various poetry books and anthologies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I and III are arranged alphabetically and series 2 is arranged chronologically.
The collection is divided into three series: I) Correspondence to Peter Finch, editor II) Editorial Correspondence, 1967-1974, and III) Manuscripts.

list.item: Series I: Correspondence to Peter Finch, editor
Series III, Subseries A: Manuscripts for Magazine Second Aeon
Series III, Subseries B: Manuscripts for Second Aeon's Small Press

did.unittitle: Series I: Correspondence to Peter Finch, editor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series I contains six boxes of correspondence to Peter Finch concerning the magazine Second Aeon. Noted correspondents include Paul Auster, Carol Berg, Robert Bly, Charles Bukowski, William Burroughs, John Cage, Cyril Hodges, Alison Knowles, Jim Morrison, Jeff Nuttall, and Peter Redgrove.

Series II: Editorial Correspondence, 1967-1974

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series II contains four boxes of correspondence to Peter Finch pertaining to editorial concerns of the magazines uch as: subscription requests, poetry admissions, thank you/congratulatory notes, and other such solicitations. This series also includes Peter Finch's personal correspondence comprising a copybook and letters dealing with his career as a poet.
